stories.storyText: â€œThis is going to be sick bro!â€ your good friend Draymond says as you guys get ready. Your other friend Will, is going to be at yours by 8:30 pm. You guys get a bunch of food at the restaurant. Itâ€™s the Lâ€™Osteria restaurant in Bristol city centre, not far from the Apple store. Will, Draymond and the guys are talking, and later you find out that April is there because her parents wanted to be home alone for the night, so they forced her to go with her brother to this outing, who was one of the guys in the group. You all finally leave the restaurant and youâ€™re headed for this mysterious â€œarcade barâ€. You have no idea whatsoever where this place is or what it's even about. You guys just make your way through the city centre. You and April start to chat a bit, and sheâ€™s quite nice to talk to and listen to. Before you know it, you two are opening up to each other. However, you are honestly such a shy person and you stutter a little bit as you talk to this girl. But sheâ€™s quite shy too. But you guys have a great conversation. She goes on about how she loves her parents, but they can be a little annoying sometimes and she often has to hide things from them. â€œI â€˜m turning 18 in a week and I canâ€™t wait!â€ she says. You can tell sheâ€™s dying to. Then her parents will probably not question her as much. You can instantly relate. You have African parents. You tell her about your move from Africa recently and how youâ€™ve struggled to make new friends, but are getting there slowly. You think youâ€™re doing a pretty decent job of talking to this girl. However, it doesnâ€™t take Draymond long to whisper in your ear when April isnâ€™t looking and say: â€œYou need to work on your game broâ€. â€œShut up.â€ you whisper back. Outside the arcade bar, there are bouncers. Will looks surprised as well. Then it hits you. This place is more than an arcade bar. Itâ€™s a club. You get a nod of approval from Draymond and Will. â€œ18,â€ you say in your most confident-sounding voice (which still carries a hint of fear) as the bouncer is still holding on to you. He takes a closer look at you. â€œYou tell the bouncer your real age. â€œIâ€™m 17,â€ you say in a shaky voice. â€œ18 and above year olds onlyâ€ he says to you. â€œB-butâ€¦â€ â€œ18-year-olds only kid!â€ he yells at you. You immediately back away. Draymond is a little disappointed but there was no use. This ending is inevitable. Will isnâ€™t super happy either and he feels pretty bad because he invited you out for this in the first place. He then says: â€œI can drive you home if you likeâ€. Itâ€™s a nice offer but, do you want to ruin the night for Will or just make it home a lot easier and avoid an hour bus journey by 10 at night?

â€œAs you walk in through the door, immediately your eyes are met with a sea of bodies swaying to pulsating beats under the flickering neon lights. Each person was looking for their chance to shine. Some of the members of the group head for the dance floor immediately, while others head for the bar. Draymond says to you in a loud voice: â€œCome on man! But then your brain really canâ€™t help but pick up the groove, and then you just let your body feel the beat and itâ€™s on from there. Youâ€™re dancing away! I mean who doesnâ€™t love â€œTitaniumâ€ by David Guetta & Sia? Then, you hear a cute female voice behind your ear. â€œHaving fun?â€ she says. Itâ€™s April from the group. â€œYeah this is great!â€ you say back. Then the DJ switches to a slightly slower song. You see a few people pairing up and slowly dancing. You are God-awful at dancing. stories.btn2Text: Back out and look for an excuse

stories.btn1Text: Go find April and tell her

stories.storyText: You discreetly get up from your seat. You donâ€™t know where the bathroom is. And itâ€™s a pretty big club as well with multiple floors. So it could be anywhere. You know that you just have to find this girl. You search all around downstairs, but you canâ€™t find the female toilets anywhere. You ask an employee and youâ€™re told that itâ€™s upstairs. You then make your way up the stairs to the first floor which has an indoor balcony. You can see the entire club from up there including the lights, disco ball and the sea of people below. Youâ€™re almost stopped in your tracks by the beautiful sight. But you snap out of it and get back to the very important mission. Eventually you do spot her, on the other flight of stairs, close to the ground floor. And sheâ€™s already heading back to her seat. Without thinking about it, you race downstairs towards her table. Youâ€™ve got to stop this.

You race downstairs, pushing past people even on the staircase. You nearly tripped and fell, and tripped other people as well. As youâ€™re approaching the table, you can see April taking the glass towards her mouth, and in the most panicked state of all, you yell out: â€œApril stop! Donâ€™t drink that!â€

In the few seconds that follow, you just realise the consequences of your brash action. The whole club is staring at you, and people start whispering. April is looking at you like youâ€™ve gone absolutely bonkers. Will and the other 3 guys in your group are doing the same. April looks like she wants the ground to open up and swallow her alive. Sheâ€™s beyond embarrassed. You realise that you need to make a justification for your action. Immediately. The guy is trying to look confused and innocent. You obviously donâ€™t fall for his pretence. â€œI think she can drink whatever she wants mate,â€ he says, slowly making his way toward you. Then he turns to April and says â€œYou can drink it Aprilâ€. â€œDonâ€™t!â€ you shout again, even in your fearful state. â€œHe spiked itâ€. The guy continues to act shocked and then the expression on his face morphs into a much angrier one. â€œWell, thatâ€™s a pretty big accusation to make mateâ€. â€œLiam whatâ€™s going on?â€ April says looking alarmed and confused. So this verminâ€™s name is Liam. Poor April. She doesnâ€™t know who, or what to believe. Liam turns to her again, but this time, with a much darker expression on his face and says â€œDrink itâ€. At this point, youâ€™ve had enough. You rush toward April and knock the drink out of her hand. Most of it spills out onto the floor. You already know whatâ€™s coming. You already know itâ€™s over for you. He charges towards your direction.

You make your way slowly to the guy, and in your bravest voice you say â€œUh, whyâ€™d you put something in her drink man?â€. The guy gives you an almost confused look, making you wonder if youâ€™re crazy. But you stick to your story. Convincing yourself that youâ€™re doing the right thing, you put on a more courageous voice and say, â€œI said, why did you slip something in her drink man?â€ Then the guy's face turns a much angrier expression and he gets up and stands over you. â€œI donâ€™t know what youâ€™re on about mate, get lostâ€. At this point, you back away slowly, actually thinking about leaving. People are already looking and whispering. Then you hear a female voice from behind the guy. The same cute one you heard earlier. â€œIs everything okay?â€ you hear from behind the guy. April looks confused and a little scared. â€œDonâ€™t touch that drink April. He spiked it,â€ you say with a bold, convincing tone. â€œIs that true Liam?â€ April asks, her voice shaking a bit. â€œSo this jerkâ€™s name is Liam,â€ you think to yourself. Then Liam turns to April and says: â€œI donâ€™t know what this Donny is on about April.â€ Then turning his head back to you he says: â€œActually I was just telling him to get lostâ€. His eyes look like they are giving you a final warning. You know that if you leave, sheâ€™s going to have that drink and God knows whatâ€™s gonna happen to her afterwards. All the anger builds up inside you. You absolutely despise people like these who prey on young girls. Then you just let it all out. â€œIâ€™m not going anywhere until you change her damn drink bro. Instead of telling me to get lost, how about you get a life and stop spiking young girls drinks!â€ Bro is not even ready to argue with you. He charges towards you.

He takes a swing at you. You immediately dive to the ground.  Youâ€™re scared out of your mind. You honestly do not want this to end in a bar fight. But you stagger back up to your feet. But as you stand up, you get one. Square in the face. Your ears are ringing, you start to taste blood in your mouth, and you can faintly hear the gasps of the crowd in the background. Punching, kicking, screaming and youâ€™re just trying to fight back and stay alive even though you know youâ€™ll probably lose. Eventually, he overpowers you and pins you to the ground. A figure comes out from nowhere and charges at the guy, gets him off you and tackles him to the ground. You slowly rise up to see whatâ€™s happening. Your head is pounding, you have that metallic taste of blood in your mouth, your ears still ringing and youâ€™re barely coordinated. You try to make who exactly kind of just saved your life. You look more closely and realise that itâ€™s Draymond! Youâ€™re not too surprised that he got into this fight, because once again bro is from the hood. IN AMERICA. (Fortunately, he didnâ€™t have a stick on him). He and Draymond get into it and in a nutshell, Draymond is beating this guy good. Heâ€™s so coordinated in the fight, knowing when to dodge and when to hit. He got at least 3 good ones in ğŸ˜‚. You hear 3 knocks from behind the curtain followed by a mature-sounding female voice. â€œAnd I had to do my older brotherâ€™s laundry for a week! Unless he woulda got knocked outâ€.  April and I could not stop laughing. Draymond has the funniest stories from when he was a kid. You tell them both that youâ€™re not risking it because you feel like the consequences arenâ€™t worth it. â€œCome on man! Youâ€™ve always wanted to go clubbing.â€ Draymond says, trying to convince you. But youâ€™ve made up your mind. â€œNah bro I canâ€™t do itâ€ he says. Draymond is a little disappointed but he gets it. You and Draymond get into Willâ€™s car and he drives you home. Thereâ€™s a bit of an awkward silence on the way home. â€œNaw itâ€™s okay man weâ€™ll be fineâ€ you say. â€œYou sure? I really donâ€™t mindâ€ Will replies. â€œYeah, weâ€™ll just get the bus innit? Go have fun in the club you then say. Will looks a bit sad for you but, you can tell that he appreciates your unselfishness.

â€œYou and Draymond eventually make it leave from the nightclub. It's about half 10. Draymond suggests that you guys walk around and do some sightseeing in Bristol to make up for not getting in. â€œNaw man, Iâ€™m going homeâ€. You and Draymond take the next bus home. You feel exhausted, and sort of regret this outing in the first place. As youâ€™re sat in the bus however, youâ€™re reflecting on how good of a friend Draymond really is. At least bro is coming home with you. Sad for both of you but it is what it is.
